page.title: 16TRANSPORT IN FORD
page.content: The A458 road joining Welshpool to Shrewsbury is the major link between Ford and the surrounding area.There are a number of small lanes leading to other small villages. Most people use a car for work, shopping or pleasure as these are all carried out far from Ford.The railway line was disbanded in 1933. A Bus service passes through Ford along a route connecting the two major towns. A school bus takes pupils aged 11 years and over to Pontesbury. Many people possess bicycles,useful for local travel. In the past the River Severn was used to transport fleeces and other goods .Now it is has a restricted passage to Shrewsbury and is used only for pleasure boats, canoeing etc.
